alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 23 at 3:01PM AKST until December 24 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR PARTS OF SE AK THROUGH CHRISTMAS... Multiple frontal bands will pass over the panhandle through the weekend bringing periods of snow. Heavy snow is moving north this afternoon and will be over the northern inner channels tonight. The southern areas have reported from 4 to 8 inches of snow so far with more on the way before becoming a wintry mix or all rain by morning. A break or decrease in snowfall rates remains on track in the morning over the north as the second frontal band tracks into the southern panhandle Saturday morning. This front will continue to move north into the northern areas by the afternoon. This front will bring another round of snow and a chance of freezing rain for the central inner channels with the south changing to all rain through Saturday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches. * WHERE...North central inner channels including Gustavus, Hoonah, Tenakee Springs, Elfin Cove, Pelican, Angoon, and Juneau. * WHEN...From 9 AM this morning to 9 PM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility near downtown Juneau. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates will continue to increase through Friday evening tapper off in the morning then increase again Saturday afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
